# The `SuffixTreeNode` Struct Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

A node in a suffix tree which represents a substring or suffix. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

A node in a suffix tree which represents a substring or suffix.

### LeftLeafIdx {#ae690b7609ccab3a4a39ecc95403f1644}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned llvm::SuffixTreeNode::LeftLeafIdx = <a href="#a9038deca521822084ac798637368c94e">EmptyIdx</a></>}>
These two indices give a range of indices for its leaf descendants.

Imagine drawing a tree on paper and assigning a unique index to each leaf node in monotonically increasing order from left to right. This way of numbering the leaf nodes allows us to associate a continuous range of indices with each internal node. For example, if a node has leaf descendants with indices i, i+1, ..., j, then its LeftLeafIdx is i and its RightLeafIdx is j. These indices are for LeafNodes in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/suffixtree">SuffixTree</a> class, which is constructed using post-order depth-first traversal.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/suffixtreenode-h/#l00057">57</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/suffixtreenode-h">SuffixTreeNode.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### RightLeafIdx {#a0f9c0cab6fab6afb4c0035abf31120cb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned llvm::SuffixTreeNode::RightLeafIdx = <a href="#a9038deca521822084ac798637368c94e">EmptyIdx</a></>}>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/suffixtreenode-h/#l00058">58</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/suffixtreenode-h">SuffixTreeNode.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
